quiz_1_question.eng: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
âŒ That is incorrect.

âœ¨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop in some ways faster than others, while some may take more time.

ğŸ’š It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development. 

â—Remember that issues with your childâ€™s development are not always obvious, and your childâ€™s condition is NOT your fault.

ğŸš© If you have concerns about your child's development, you should consult with a professional to get support and advice.

quiz_2_question.eng: Letâ€™s now think about how children learn by doing. What do you think - True or False: It is OK to let your child continue trying to do something a few times even if they are not doing it correctly.

âœ¨ Thatâ€™s correct! 

ğŸš² Your child wants to learn and we should support them to continue trying, even if they get it wrong.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
At this stage of development, children are curious about their surroundings and want to learn how to do things on their own. ğŸŒ· 

They will begin to explore the world more and express themselves using emotions and language, too. ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£

3ï¸âƒ£ To support the healthy development of your child, use these 3 tips:

section_1_text.eng:
â° Learning new things takes time. your child may struggle at first - and thatâ€™s OK! With time and practise, they will succeed. 
â­ You can also help by breaking large tasks into smaller ones, and with words of encouragement.
ğŸŒ· your child may have big emotions. This is OK! In time, your child will learn to manage their emotions.

section_2_text.eng: ğŸš² As your child grows, they will become more curious. Let them explore while you keep an eye on their safety! ğŸŒ± If your child wants to do tasks on their own, such as tying their own shoelaces or combing their own hair, you can teach them and help them do it safely.

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸ§¸ your child may not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught, especially through play!
ğŸ† Praise your child when they share their things with others.

quiz_1_question.eng: Your home activity is to invite your child to play with you. Let your child choose what they would like to play and follow their lead. Do you have time to do it today? â­

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! ğŸ’™ Letting your child choose helps build confidence, independence, and curiosity as they grow.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's OK! It can be hard to find time. Even a short playtime where your child chooses the activity can make a big difference. You can set some time aside to play together tomorrow! ğŸŒ±
